intro: [WRONG START] Embilia oblongifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf embelia, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other aromatic plants like eucalyptus. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, black seeds. Embelia oblongifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory properties.
